gurmukhi: bhu ju`D kY AMqir iDAwn BXo niB mY pRgtXo muK qy aucrXo ] Ab qoih sMGwrq hO pl mY Dnu bwn sMBwr kY pwn DrXo ]1302]
transliteration: Bahu Juddh Kai Antar(i) Dhiaan Bhayo Nabh(i) Mai Pragtyo Moukh Te Oucdaryo|| Ab Toh(i) Sanhaarat Hau Pal Mai Dhan(u) Baan Sanbhaar Kai Paan Ddaryo||1302||
translation: After a great deal of fighting, that demon disappeared and manifesting himself in the sky, said this, “O Shakti Singh ! now I am going to kill you;” saying thus, he held up his bow and arrows.1302.

gurmukhi: bwnn kI brKw krq nB qy auqrXo kRUr ] puin AwXo rn BUm mY AiDk lrXo br sUr ]1303]
transliteration: Baanan Kibarkhaa Karat Nabh Te Udaryo Kroor|| Poun(i) Aayo Ran Bhoom Mai Adhik Daryo Bar Soor||1303||
translation: Showering his arrows, Karurdhvaja descended from the sky and entering the battlefield again that mighty warrior fought more terribly.1303.

gurmukhi: bIrn mwr kY dYq blI Apny icq mY Aiq hI hrKXo hY ] hI qij SMk inSMk BXO SkqyS sMGwrby ko srKXo hY ]
transliteration: Bderan Maar Kai Dait Baliapne Chit Mai At(i) Hiharkhyo Hai Hitaj(i) Shank Nishank Bhayou Shaktesh Sanhaarbe Ko Sarkhyo Hai||
translation: Killing the warriors that powerful demon was extremely pleased and with a firm mind marched forward in order to kill Shakti Singh;

gurmukhi: ijau cplw cmkY dmkY bir kwNp lIXo kr mY krKXo hY ] myG pry br bUMdn ijau sr jwl krwlin iqau brKXo hY ]1304]
transliteration: Jio Chaplaa Chamkai Damkai Bar(i) Kaanp Leeyo Kar Mai Karkhyo Hai|| Megh Dare Bar Boundan Ji Sar Jaal Karaalan(i) Tio Barkhyo Hai||1304||
translation: Like the flash of lightning, the bow in his hand became mercurial and its twang was audible; just as the rain-drops come from the clouds, in the same manner there was shower of arrows.1304.

gurmukhi: pg n trXo brbIr skq isMG Duj kRUr qy ] Acl rhXo rnDIr ijau AMgd rwvn sBw ]1305]
transliteration: Pag Na Daryo Barbeer Sakat Singh Dhuj Kroor Te|| Achal Rahyo Randheer Jio Anad Raavan Sabhaa||1305||
translation: Shakti Singh did not retrace even one step in his fight with Karurdhvaja and the manner in which Angad stood firmly in the court of Ravana, in the same manner, he also remained firm.1305.

gurmukhi: Bwjq nwihn Awhv qy SkqyS mhw blvMq sMBwrXo ] jwl ijqo Air ky sr ko qbhI AgnwXuD swQ pRjwrXo ]
transliteration: Bhaajat Naahin Oohav Te Shaktesh Mahaa Balvant Sanbhdaryo|| Jaal Jito Ar(i) Ke Sr Ko Tab-hiagnaayudh Saath Prahdaryo||
translation: The mighty warrior Shakti Singh did not run away from the battlefield and the snare of the arrows created by the enemy was intercepted by him with his fire-shafts;

gurmukhi: pwn lXo Dnu bwn irswie kY kRUrDujw isr kwit auqwrXo ] AYsy hnXo irp ijau mGvw bl kY biRqrwsur dYq sMGwrXo ]1306]
transliteration: Paan Layo Dhan(u) Baan Risaae Kai Kroordhujaa Sir Kaattee Outdaryo|| Aise Hanyo Rip Jio Maghvaa Bal Kai Britraasur Dait Sanhdaryo||1306||
translation: In his rage, he took up his bow and arrows and knocked down the head of Karurdhvaja; he killed the demon like the killing of Vritasura by Indra.1306.

gurmukhi: skiq isMG jb kRUrDuj mwrXo BUm igrwie ] ijau brKw irq ky smY daur pry Ar rwie ]1307]
transliteration: Dakat(i) Singh Jab Kroordhuj Mdaryo Bhoom Giraae|| Jio Barkhaa Rit Ke Samai Daur Dare Ar Raae||1307||
translation: When Shakti Singh knocked down Karurdhvaja, the enemies began to run away for safety just like the people running hither and thither in order to save themselves from getting wet in the rain.1307.
